results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Web Scribble provides market-leading, innovative career center software to thousands of customers and hundreds of associations around the world. Associations depend on Web Scribble's job board software to provide clear member value, develop deep member insight and enhanced engagement, connect talented and qualified job seekers with the right employers, drive non-dues revenue, and advance shared missions. Web Scribble is currently in a high growth phase – growing 480% over the last three years – and was recently named to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America.

As an Account Executive, you’ll fill a key role in acquiring new association customers and creating raving fans.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Have a true sales “hunter” mentality and conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social to connect with new prospects
  • Manage prospects from lead to close.
  • Provide an exceptional customer experience.
  • Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, creating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects.
  • Cultivate lasting relationships with customers.
  • Crush your quota.

Requirements

  • 0 - 3 years of relevant work/closing experience.
  • Previous SaaS and enterprise software experience.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented, and well-organized.
  • A strong team player but still a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment.

Benefits

  • We offer Scribblers a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs.
  • 401K program to help you invest in your future.
  • Paid time off to promote a healthy work-life blend.
  • Company-wide quarterly outings to recharge.
  • Competitive salary and uncapped commission structure.

 

Web Scribble is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

results.title: Senior Account Executive - Enterprise
results.description:
More time is spent on Insight Timer everyday than all other wellbeing and meditation apps. How? Combine 22+ million organic downloads, with the world's largest collection of wellbeing experts and content, plus industry leading app engagement that's 5x stronger than competing platforms.

In 2020 we added Workplace offerings to the platform. Today 65k companies have signed up, and that’s growing by 200 new companies every single day, including most of the Fortune 100, Fortune 1000 and beyond.

We’re now building a Sales team to bring our Premium solutions to the Enterprise. For the accelerating number of companies building Diversity, Equity & Inclusion into the very fabric of their organizations, Insight Timer’s Diversity-first Wellbeing platform is indispensable. Every employee can access world-class wellbeing teachers and content on Insight Timer, no matter their race, culture, sexual orientation, gender, ability, belief system, age or life experience. We’ve been piloting Premium Enterprise solutions with top companies and brands for a little while, and we are now ready to release case studies and testimonials to prove its impact.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Account Executive, with significant experience selling to companies with 5k employees or more. This is a great opportunity to get into a Sales team at its inception, with enormous opportunity for impact; on day 1 you’ll have 65k active leads to select from, each packed with data ready for you to have an insight-driven conversation with top executives at target accounts.

You should be passionate about both Wellbeing and Diversity & Inclusion, with a special skill for sparking that passion in others. You will engage in storytelling to help illustrate concepts and develop trust, be as comfortable in spreadsheets as you are in slides, have a strong business and SaaS acumen, and be able to connect dots top-down and bottom's up.

Given this is a foundational Sales team, we are looking for Sales professionals with strong entrepreneurial spirit. You’ll have a sense of urgency, mission, and be obsessively organized. This is a remote opportunity based in the US-West Coast.

Responsibilities

  • Drive revenue by inspiring senior executives at leading companies to urgently prioritize mental health and wellbeing, for all their people.
  • Successfully negotiate six and seven-figure contracts with C-suite, Senior HR, and Finance executives.
  • Create and execute on top-down & bottom-up account strategies, that enable both sales velocity and total revenue.
  • Be fluid with multi-motion Sales process, by prospecting new potential business independently, whilst leveraging all the benefits of Insight Timer’s PLG motion.
  • Navigate an enterprise to map stakeholders, build champions, generate buy-in and close deals with C-Level decision makers.
  • Serve as an expert to the customer to make informed recommendations about their business, benefits programs, diverse workforce and culture.
  • Instincts to recognize organizational, financial and behavioral structures and obstacles.
  • Impeccable customer skills: communication, compassion, and integrity, whilst finding ways to present Insight Timer’s unique value verbally, in writing, and quantitatively.
  • Coordinate with Insight Timer’s Customer Success team to ensure successful implementations that lead to great adoption and engagement.
  • Strategically manage up-sell / cross-sell opportunities.

About you

  • 8+ years of Sales success driving growth in a SaaS Sales team, with 4+ years of Account Executive experience selling to Enterprise.
  • Track record of over-achieving (top 10-20% of company).
  • Proven ability to prospect with Enterprise customers to maximize revenue growth.
  • Ability to land net new customers, whilst growing Net Dollar Retention by expanding existing customer usage and new product adoption.
  • Experience working with marketing, business, and product teams to find efficient paths to successful and profitable customers.
  • Holds self and others accountable for performance goals.
  • A drive to learn, succeed, and lead by example, adaptable to changing conditions, being comfortable with high levels of ambiguity, and possessing an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Prior Sales methodology training.
  • Bonus: Experience during the scaling of a software or SaaS Sales organization.
  • Bonus: Previous success with selling into HR and Benefits teams is a plus.
  • Bonus: Salesforce/Hubspot and/or Outreach.io proficiency.

Benefits

You’ll be able to share in our success through a generous employee options plan, as well as an uncapped Sales compensation plan.

We have dedicated learning and development budgets to support your growth, as well as a competitive benefits plan.

We’re remote first, with no central office location. We dial in from all over the world, and it’s important that our team is just as diverse as our community of users, customers and teachers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!

results.title: Enterprise MarTech Account Executive
results.description:
Who We Are:

At Munvo, our mission is to enable enterprise organizations to realize the full value of their marketing technology. We are a leading marketing technology consulting firm providing expert consulting services and software solutions. We work with our technology partners Adobe, ActionIQ, Salesforce, SAS, Pega and HCL (Unica) to implement marketing solutions that improve customer experiences and increase customer satisfaction.

Who We’re Looking For:

We are seeking a U.S.-based Enterprise Account Executive to be responsible for selling consulting services and Munvo products to Fortune 500 organizations. The successful candidate will work closely with our US Managing Director, Consulting Managers and Marketing team to position and sell professional marketing services such as:

  • MarTech planning and roadmaps
  • Technology implementations
  • Data architecture design and reviews
  • Marketing operations services
  • Data & analysis services
  • MarTech training
  • Munvo software solutions

 

The Enterprise Account Executive will be supported by a marketing and inside sales team to assist with the generation of contacts and leads. In addition, the position is supported by senior professional services delivery managers for the shaping and presentation of sales proposals.

What You'll Do as an Enterprise Account Executive:

  • Establish, develop, and maintain business relationships with prospects and customers
  • Identify and develop business opportunities in new accounts in the western region
  • Work with strategic partners on co-selling activities to joint accounts
  • Prepare, present and review services proposals to customers
  • Provide transition activities from sales to delivery post sale

Requirements

What You Need to Succeed:

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in an executive sales role
  • Experience selling consulting services into Fortune 1000 organizations
  • Experience working within MarTech partner ecosystems
  • Excellent communications skills (verbal and written)
  • Experience working in sales tools such as Salesforce.com, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, LeadFeeder, HubSpot, etc.
  • Ability to work autonomously. Munvo’s global workforce is distributed across time zones. Working on MS Teams is the norm, office meetings are not.
  • Willingness to travel on average 2 times per month to meet with prospects and customers.

Benefits

What You’ll Benefit from:

  • Competitive base salary and quarterly bonus based on performance
  • Health insurance package employer contribution
  • Mobile phone plan coverage
  • 4 weeks of annual paid vacation

Why You’ll Love Working at Munvo:

  • Join a growing company that specializes in the rapidly changing marketing technology field
  • When developing proposals to clients, you will enjoy the support of a multi-disciplinary team consisting of software architects, business analysts, software developers, and project managers
  • As a Sales Account Executive you will be able to leverage Munvo’s solid credentials resulting from 300 projects with Fortune 1000 corporations since 2005.

results.title: Sales Operations Associate
results.description:
Powered by People (PBP) is looking for an exceptional Sales Ops Associate to join our growing Sales team. You will focus on communications with our rapidly expanding group of global makers, ensuring they have the information they need in real time to continue selling to buyers across the US and Canada – and soon Europe. On a daily basis you will work with handmade and small batch businesses across five continents managing orders, payments and financing.

You are detail-oriented and flexible problem-solver. This role involves frequent communication with PBP buyers and makers, so the ideal candidate will enjoy communicating with people and working in a social environment. You will manage all sales orders in the PBP platform and ensure their on time confirmation, shipment and delivery. You will utilize a variety of software tools to navigate accounts and create solutions for order issues.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Order Management:

  • Manage Marketplace orders from placement to fulfillment
  • Collaborate with the Merchandising team to support larger transactions
  • Data entry and management related to orders and inventory
  • Support documenting and improving existing Sales Ops processes

Logistics – Work with logistics partners to resolve customs and import issues

Finance Operations –Work with the Finance team to ensure timely payments and payouts

Customer Support – Help resolve Buyer and Maker technical and non-technical issues

Requirements

Education & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of work experience
  • 1-3 years of customer service, sales or related experience
  • Flexible schedule to accommodate business needs during peak season
  • Experience in website interaction and backend tools is preferred, including Shopify, Zoho, and other CRM tools

Computer & Technical Skills

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, as we currently support through a variety of mediums including phone, email and chat
  • Empathetic to and understanding of our customers’ unique experiences. You are passionate about delighting customers every single day!
  • Ruthlessly organized, disciplined, and comfortable managing competing priorities with care
  • Confident adapting to rapid change in a metrics-based and performance-driven environment
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully multitask. This role involves navigating and diagnosing website experiences while maintaining focus on the customer and their immediate needs.
  • Ability to quickly pick up a variety of software applications with ease

We have found the above qualifications are the most common predictors for a successful Sales Ops Associate at PBP. That said, if your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can rock the role, we’d love to learn more about you.We are a global company with team members in Canada, Kenya, South Africa, India, USA, Turkey, Mexico, Colombia, and The United Kingdom. You can be based anywhere, however, preference will be given to those based in Kenya. You will work closely with team members based in Kenya and interact with Makers working within or close to East African Time.

Benefits

PBP is a social enterprise startup whose mission and values of creativity, responsibility, innovation, diversity, transparency and sustainability are a force for good. Join a passionate global, remote-first team using technology to connect small batch makers and independent brands with buyers and conscious consumers. We provide meaningful, cross-functional and collaborative work, support establishing your home desk, co-working space in our hubs, and opportunities to travel. We are reimagining a world Powered by People. Come join us.

results.title: Outbound Account Executive
results.description:
We are looking for a creative, flexible, high-energy individual to take opportunities from lead to closed won, while navigating complex sourcing models, legal negotiations, and highly technical product conversations. The ideal candidate has a strong knowledge of and experience in IaaS and SaaS sales models, and a proven track record of closing deals. The Sinch Email Executive specializes in consulting with clients, aligning to business goals and managing resources in the development and delivery of solutions that meet and exceed client expectations. Solid work ethic, personal accountability, adaptability to change, strong organization skills and strategic thinking are all assets’ candidates will need to leverage to be successful in this roll. The right candidate will eagerly pursue opportunities to upsell existing customers as well as target and close net new accounts ranging anywhere from $200 MRR to $20,000 MRR.

 

Responsibilities
  • Operates at a highly transactional pace and are key levers in building promoter customers.
  • Field incoming leads as well as generate outbound calls, occasionally making client site visits and presentations.
  • Uses internal relationships to exceed customer expectations and provide support to the team.
  • Engages and persuades mid- level to senior level management.
  • Works with Technical Account Managers to vet onboarding the right large volume senders, weeding out bad actors before we engage in a lengthy sales process.
  • Must have the ability to see patterns and deconstruct problems to develop solutions.
  • Identify multiple causes, effects and customer solutions.
  • Moderate to advanced configurations-cloud computing preferred. Sells to entry and senior level management.
  • Customer centric mindset, with the ability to interface with support team on a daily basis.
  • Utilizes Sales force, proposal tools, and other sales utilities.

Requirements

  • Operates at a highly transactional pace and are key levers in building promoter customers.
  • Field incoming leads as well as generate outbound calls, occasionally making client site visits and presentations.
  • Uses internal relationships to exceed customer expectations and provide support to the team.
  • Engages and persuades mid- level to senior level management.
  • Works with Technical Account Managers to vet onboarding the right large volume senders, weeding out bad actors before we engage in a lengthy sales process.
  • Must have the ability to see patterns and deconstruct problems to develop solutions.
  • Identify multiple causes, effects and customer solutions.
  • Moderate to advanced configurations-cloud computing preferred. Sells to entry and senior level management.
  • Customer centric mindset, with the ability to interface with support team on a daily basis.
  • Utilizes Sales force, proposal tools, and other sales utilities.

 

(*Colorado Only*) Annual on target earnings of $118,000 (64,900 base salary + $53,100 commission) + benefits.

*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the compensation for this role when being hired in Colorado.

Benefits

  • STAY HEALTHY: We offer 100% employer-paid comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. A variety of supplemental plans are also provided to meet your individual needs including access to telehealth for all participants.
  • CARE FOR YOURSELF: Take advantage of our free virtual counseling resources through our global Employee Assistance Program. Your mental health is as important as your physical health.
  • SECURE YOUR FUTURE: Plan for your future with our Roth and Pre-tax 401(k) options including an employer match for all participants.
  • TAKE A BREAK: Enjoy 5+ weeks of paid time off. We value balance and understand that performance at work requires time to rest at home and/or rejuvenate on vacation.
  • PUT FAMILY FIRST: We know that families can be built in a variety of ways; therefore, we offer paid parental leave and family planning support through Maven.
  • WORK WHEREVER: Our flexible remote work offerings allow you to work wherever you’re the most productive and successful. It’s what you do, not where you work, that matters.
  • TREAT YOURSELF: Our comprehensive anniversary program offers a personalized experience in recognition of milestones achieved.
  • MAKE AN IMPACT: Support betterment in your community and beyond by taking paid time off to support a volunteer program of your choice.

We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in all aspects of our business. We are committed to building a company that empowers individuals from a diverse set of backgrounds and values diversity of thought as a beacon for performance. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

results.title: Director of Growth
results.description:
Director of Growth

Type: Full-Time

Location: Remote

Company Background: Seventh Dimension LLC provides focused customer support in two core competencies Training & Support Services. Since 2015, we have provided customers with flexible, adaptable, and creative approaches to solving complex problems. We are a proven prime contractor that understands future operating environments, fiscal constraints, and current force requirements. We are a SDVOSB in North Carolina conducting operations and supporting contracts globally.

Position Summary: Overall, this position is responsible for generating new income business opportunities for Seventh Dimension in support of strategic initiatives. The Director of Growth is responsible for filling and maintaining the Seventh Dimension's opportunity pipeline, executing the BD process, maintaining a high Probability of Win for those opportunities selected for capture and bid, and in general growing business within the DoD, Federal Agencies, and target markets.

As the Director of Growth, you will focus on 10-12 opportunities below $5M annually / 4-6 opportunities between $5M and $10M annually / 2-3 opportunities above $10M annually. These opportunities can be a mixture of prime and subcontract opportunities with the expectation of 50% to be prime opportunities.

You will be part of an amazing team to identify and develop opportunities for business expansion. Seventh Dimension understands the importance of quality of work life as an essential investment to the stability and prosperity of the company. We take pride in knowing this impacts our employees and customers. This position is a critical addition to Seventh Dimension growth campaign which has tripled over the past two years.

Responsibilities:

• Identify and develop opportunities for business expansion and close on existing opportunities already in the pursuit pipeline in our growing business.

• Build relationships and foster business within our capability areas (Training, Exercise Support, and Service Support) with DoD and Federal customers

• Conduct opportunity research and qualification, leads capture and pre-proposal activities and arranges / coordinates business development meetings supported by Corporate Leadership

• Responsible for development and implementation of an integrated action/contact plan based upon capture analysis. This includes aiding in all required pursuit planning and ensuring opportunities are accurately reflected in the pipeline management system

• Support and informs proposal review, leads proposal solutioning, supports pricing analysis, and coordinates with Technical Subject Matter Experts to develop proposal strategies and technical content

• Lead win theme development, develops and maintains a detailed capture plan and provides capture status updates at capture reviews

• Effectively interacting with colleagues and executives in a collaborative environment

Requirements:

• An active DoD Secret clearance

• A Bachelor's degree or higher (experience in lieu of degree can be substituted with 10 years government contracting experience)

• 10+ years' experience growing and fostering business within the DoD and Federal Agencies

• Candidates must have an understanding of the roles of the various functions within a defense contracting business and have an in-depth understanding of U.S. Department of Defense Solicitations and RFPs.

• Strong research and analytical skills for business analytics and business development

• Understanding of Work Breakdown Structures, typical Proposal sections and evaluation criteria

• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel functionality and formulas is required, working knowledge of Microsoft Word.

• Good interpersonal skills are important as well as high quality work, attention to detail, and the ability to work within time constraints.

Travel: Ability to travel up to 15%

DISCLAIMER: The listed duties are not intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification, only a representative summary of primary duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may not be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional position specific duties.

Seventh Dimension, LLC is a Veteran friendly employer and provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws.

results.title: Account Director, Sports
results.description:
Company Description

At Viral Nation, we specialize in building social-first ecosystems for brands to connect with the modern consumer journey. Our integrated solutions align strategy, talent, media, and technology with culturally relevant creativity to scale the world’s fastest-growing digital brands.  Viral Nation offers a fluid, creative, and growth-oriented environment that will support your ambitions to apply your talents in an open, collaborative, and fast-paced culture. We’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver strategies, and we’re just getting started. Our ability to stay at the forefront of the industry has fueled our success and will guide us in paving the path forward.

 2021 was a transformational year for Viral Nation, having grown by 200% and we have even bigger ambitions for 2022 and beyond.  While we continuously exceed our goals, we need your help – our success is only as great as our people.  Strong performance leads to high expectations and we need to keep raising the bar!

Our Values

We Constantly Evolve: Embracing change is both an opportunity and a necessity!

Courage: Challenging the norm drives us forward!

Diversity: We strive for excellence and recognize that our differences make us stronger. We respect and seek out the inclusion of differences, realizing we can learn from each other!

Resilience: Adversity is a springboard for growth!

Viral Nation is seeking a dedicated Account Director, Sports with a robust mix of influencer marketing, social & digital media, analytics, and content marketing experience who will help achieve the maximum impact of the brand story. By nature, they are a confident, courageous and strategic leader who excels in building bulletproof relationships with both their clients as well as their internal team. They are known to bring value to every conversation and know when and how to challenge the status quo within our ever-changing industry. 

The Account Director, Sports is accountable for leading, retaining and growing their dedicated portfolio of clientele. They lead the day-to-day execution of client programs and elevate brand storytelling, insights and analytics. They know the components needed for flawless execution, and delivery, and push for exceptionally creative and unique work across a mix of global clientele. They lead the account teams responsible for influencer engagement, paid social and measurement, in addition to creative ideation, managing briefs, building and managing client relationships, presenting concepts, developing proposals and delivering clear POVs on trends that impact clients’ business. 



Job Description
  • Establish and grow a strong relationship with multiple senior client stakeholders through a demonstration of industry knowledge and the application to business challenges and growing and driving revenue 
  • Establish and maintain relationships with all key stakeholders 
  • Hands-on leader with execution and negotiation for Celeb, Celeb Influencer and Macro talent
  • Liaises and orchestrates directly with all internal teams 
  • Manage & coach a team of 15-20 members through navigation of client challenges and campaign executions
  • Create pitches and RFP’s 
  • Identify and understand problem-solving techniques and facilitate a process to solve issues (internally and externally)
  • Proactively keep abreast of industry trends and implications on client business 
  • Develop and motivate the Account team to deliver the highest standards in leadership, insight, delivery, and spirit in the industry, as seen by clients and internal partners
  • Mentor the team to maximize individuals’ growth, and harness the strengths and opportunities of each team member



Qualifications

 

  • 5+ years of influencer, digital & social marketing experience driving talent partnerships and revenue growth
  • Experience in the sports, consumer tech and gaming industry is ideal 
  • Previously managed a team of 10 people
  • Managed over 1M+ budgets 
  • Strong understanding of influencer marketing and social media platforms including contract negotiations, content development and measurement
  • Expert knowledge of paid and organic influencer tactics 
  • Proficient in interpreting and applying where necessary information provided by influencer management software (such as Creator IQ, Klear, Tagger, Upfluence)
  • Excelling project management skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Works collaboratively with planning and creative teams to drive business outcomes
  • Expert grasp of social media platforms
  • Good understanding of paid and social amplification
  • Proficient with MS Office, Google or other presentation software
  • Robust experience with cross-channel integration

Nice to have:

  • Photoshop, Canva, animation, motion graphics
  • Certification in Facebook Blueprint, Twitter Flight School and/or Google Analytics
  • Social media tools like Sprout, Sprinklr, Hootsuite
  • CRM software like Hubspot
  • Meta software experience



Additional Information
 

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Early-stage venture-backed startup looking for the first full cycle Account Executive to support our VP of Sales and the early sales foundation and growth. A good fit if you like moving fast, having an impact, working on a variety of different things, and thanks to all of that learning a lot.



📍Where do you come in?

You will help Rob (our experienced Sales leader) shape and lead a sales function, build processes and ways of working and be a fundamental, landing revenue team member. Coaching & training is at the forefront of everything we do. Improving you as a salesperson is going to be Rob's number 1 priority.

We have many quality inbounds, so your role will be a mix of outbound to our target accounts, converting existing high-intent opportunities, and finding and uncovering new ones amongst our 1000s of freemium customers. Survicate offers the fastest time-to-value on the market, so you can expect closing deals in days or weeks, not months.



🎯 The impact you’ll make by joining us:

Within 1 month you’ll:

  • Be embedded in our sales process and philosophy - from outbound to running a sale you’ll have a clear understanding of the “jobs to be done” and the strategies we use to support them.

  • Start running your own sales cycles alongside senior management to make sure you’re confident and up to speed quickly

  • Become confident and clear in how we use content and cadences to build pipelines and have generated your own to start working with.

Within 3 months you’ll:

  • Start closing your first deals and making a material impact on our revenue.

  • Funnel feedback from prospects and customers to our product team and help us shape our roadmap

Within 6+ months you’ll (and as we are still an early-stage startup – this might change pretty a lot in the time):

  • Deliver value to our prospects, help us continuously educate the market, and as a result consistently meet or exceed your quota.

  • Come up with some sales operations suggestions – we’re constantly focusing on ways to be more efficient and optimizing our sales flow is key to this

💪 Skills you’ll need:

  • Bring the knowledge and experience with modern + innovative ways of engaging with prospects and customers

  • Clear and concise communication + presentation skills and a huge drive to make an immediate impact

  • An understanding of SaaS structures – we are building a SaaS for SaaS!

➕ What are the special areas you can learn here:

  • How to run an effective modern sales process with a huge focus on discovery and influencing vs. assisting a sale.
  • How to scale an early-stage business, be a core part of the strategy for how we build revenue and the teams to support it.
  • Evolving Outbound strategies in a world where buyer consideration is much more informed.

🤔 Why this role might not be a fit?

  • You aren’t interested in an early-stage startup environment. We care a lot about our team members and we try to avoid the chaos of the popular caricatures of startups. That being said, we seek to move quickly, we seek to do what’s best for our customers (sometimes without a lot of guidance), and you’ll be more resource-constrained than working at a larger company (e.g., Facebook, Google). In these big tech companies your base compensation might be also a bit higher though your efforts can much more directly impact how valuable the equity upside is here. That environment might be exciting – or it might not align with what you’re looking for.
  • You’re uncomfortable with change and ambiguity. Don't take us wrong. It doesn't mean we are changing foundational stuff every second day. No! We are really trying to build a solid foundation and keep building on top of that. We are just saying – if we all do our jobs well, the company will continue to grow rapidly. And that might mean your role will likely shift in scope to accommodate that growth and that new challenges will emerge that we don’t yet have the answers to. Depending on what you’re looking for, that dynamic may not be a fit (which is OK)!

🤝  Who you’ll be working with?

Rob is our VP of Sales (ex-Segment sales leader) and he is the one you would be reporting to and working closely the most with. Outside of this we’re *building* a team - we hope for you to have 4-5 teammates quickly for you to work with and excel alongside it!

 

FINANCE 💸:

Salary of PLN 10,000 to PLN 15,000 net + VAT (on target salary)💰
Commission is uncapped!

 

👋 Why Survicate?

  • Amazing Clients – we have the best Clients in the world, and it’s not a joke!
  • The real impact on shaping the future of communication with our Clients
  • Flexible working hours
  • 26 days of paid annual leave for all employees
  • Personal Development Budget - budget for online courses, books, conferences, language lessons
  • Professional Skills Development Budget
  • Company events 
  • Personal assistant (AskHenry) & mental health support platform (HearMe)
  • Multisport cards, PetHelp, private health care & benefit platform
  • Fair salary (base + bonus)
  • MacBook (or your preferred laptop)
  • Regular recognition, gifts, and awards
  • Friendly atmosphere and a great team
  • ... and many more to come as we listen to your needs!
